required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Study to Evaluate the Effectiveness of onabotulinumtoxinA in Preventing Headaches in Patients With Chronic Migraines

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the effectiveness of OnabotulinumtoxinA to prevent headaches in patients with Chronic Migraine.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Company decision due to enrollment challenges.
clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective

arm_group.description: Previous treatment with onabotulinumtoxinA for Chronic Migraine based on retrospective review of medical records.

intervention.description: Previous treatment with onabotulinumtoxinA for Chronic Migraine.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with chronic migraines who received a minimum of two consecutive treatment cycles of 100 units onabotulinumtoxinA and a minimum of two consecutive treatment cycles with the OnabotulinumtoxinA dosing between 155 and 195 units.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History of chronic migraines
- 15 or more headache days over a 30 day period
- A minimum of 2 consecutive treatment cycles of 100 units onabotulinumtoxinA and a minimum of 2 consecutive treatment cycles with the onabotulinumtoxinA dosing between 155 and 195 units
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any treatment cycle dose of onabotulinumtoxinA greater than 200 units
